trans-unit.source: Renders a list of items as either a static display or an interactive list.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This control supports templated rendering by using device template sets and internal pagination.

For more information, see [Device Filtering Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bdfeaa58-dedd-4c0d-8610-988aac0eff19) and [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Notifies the server control that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the parsed element.
Creates a child control using the view state.
This method supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Called by device adapters to create the default templated user interface (UI) for the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Set to `true` if the instantiated templates must bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request).
Set to `false` if the templates must not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Creates items in an items collection from the specified dataSource parameter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Inheriting classes can override this method for custom data-binding behavior.
The source from which items in the collection are created.
Gets or sets the name of the data member to extract when data binding to a list data source.
The default value is an empty string ("").
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This property is only used if the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataSource%2A> property is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, rather than of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>.
The name of the data member to extract when data binding to a list data source.
Gets or sets the data source of the list that is being bound.
The default value is `null`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To bind a data source to a list, you must first use the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBind%2A> method to ensure data binding.
The data source can either be of type <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable>, or it can be of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>.
If the data source is of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.IListSource>, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataMember%2A> field to specify which member to extract.
The data source of the list that is being bound.
Specifies which property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text"></xref> property.
The default is `null`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text"></xref> property.
Specifies which property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value"></xref> property.
The default is `null`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The property of a data-bound item to use when binding an item's <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the type of decoration used for items.
The default value is `None`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Where the target device permits, list items can be undecorated, or decorated with bullets or numbers.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDecoration> enumeration has the following values:
Name
Description
No decoration.
List items are decorated with a bullet.
List items are decorated with a number.
An enumerated value representing the type of decoration used for items.
Determines whether the server control contains child controls.
If it does not, it creates child controls.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use this method to ensure that the templates are instantiated to allow programmatic access to the instantiated contents of a template.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> control has an event handler registered for the appropriate <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
`true` if the control has an event handler registered for the appropriate <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand"></xref> event; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of items in the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The number of items in the control.
Occurs when the user selects a command that is associated with a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When you render a list by using templates, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand> event handler is called through the event-bubbling mechanism of ASP.NET.

The event handler is passed an argument of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs>, which contains information about the source item and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> property of the control that generated the event.
This allows you to render a single list item with multiple associated interactions.
On default rendering, the control provides a basic user interface (UI) that allows the user to click list items.

On postback, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand> event handler is called with an argument of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs>, which contains information about the source item.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> property of this object is `null`.
Occurs when an item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> is bound to data.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> is created and data-bound, this event handler sets the properties of the list item from arbitrary expressions.
An item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> is of type <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem>.
This event is raised as each data source item is bound.

This is the best time to filter or group items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> collection, by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> Property.
Returns the collection of items in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection"></xref> list.
The default value is an empty collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

You can add or remove items from a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> class.
The collection of items in the list.
Gets a value indicating whether the items in the list are to be treated as hyperlinks.
The default value is `false`.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

If the value of this property is `true`, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataTextField%2A> property is used to display the text of the hyperlink, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.DataValueField%2A> property is used to specify the target URL.
Command events will not be generated for these links.

Thus, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemsAsLinks%2A> property is set to `true`, an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.OnItemCommand%2A> method will not be called because a new page will be loaded through an HTTP call.
`true` if items in the list are to be treated as hyperlinks; otherwise, `false`.
Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.SaveViewState"></xref> method.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the control state to be restored.
Determines whether the event for the server control is passed up the page's UI server control hierarchy.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The source of the event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
`true` if the event has been canceled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.DataBinding"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
Called when a list item generates an event as a result of user interaction.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand> event.
Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Called when a list item is data bound.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default implementation raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemDataBind> event.
Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.
An object (defined by <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListDataBindEventArgs"></xref>) that contains event data.
Called when the control is custom paginated and needs more data.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object defined by an <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains event data.
Paginates a control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Contains the index number of the current page prior to pagination.
Contains the index number of the current page after pagination.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> object of a postback event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> object that represents an optional event argument to be passed to the event handler.
Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Returns the server control's current view state.
If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns `null`.
Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This object is accessible through the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState"></xref> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent(System.String)"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> interface.
An optional event argument to be passed to the event handler.
